#summary The I18N support

=== GWT way to support I18N ===

==== Configure Validation Framework for I18N support ====
{{{
ValidatorFactory factory = Validation.byProvider(GWTEntValidatorProvider.class).configure()
	.addI18NMessages(GWT.create(ValidationMessages.class))
	.buildValidatorFactory();

Validator validator = factory.getValidator();
}}}


=== Message Format ===

  In JSR303, it expected a message format like this:
{{{
javax.validation.constraints.Max.message=must be less than or equal to {value}
}}}

  But in GWT, there are two difference, A)The key of message must be a method in a Java interface, so it can't contain "."; B)The parameter in message only support number, for example {0} but not {value}, so we have to change it to following:
{{{
javax_validation_constraints_Max_message=must be less than or equal to {0}
}}}
